Description: Terracotta figure vase with a spout in the form of an animal, probably a bull. Hand-made and hollow, with a hole cut for the mouth/spout. Yellow slip (?). Red-brown fabric with light brown surface.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallel from Late Period Memphis (Petrie Museum UC48319). Vessels with bull spouts were also produced in Cyprus during the Cypro-Archaic II period (Caubet et al 1998, nos. 709-710). Caubet, A., Fourrier, S. and Queyrel, A. 1998. L'art des modeleurs d'argile: Antiquités de Chypre, coroplastique. Vol, 2. Paris: Musée du Louvre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.080) (Phase 3)
